message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the positive modified acid-fast stain indicate a diagnosis of cryptosporidiosis. Nitazoxanide is the recommended first-line treatment for immunocompromised patients with cryptosporidiosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and stool examination suggest cryptosporidiosis, which can be treated with nitazoxanide. Mesalamine enema is used to treat inflammatory bowel disease, which is not the diagnosis here. Metronidazole is used to treat bacterial or protozoal infections, but not specifically for cryptosporidiosis. Supportive therapy alone would not be enough to treat the infection.

Metronidazole is not effective against this organism. Mesalamine enema is used in the treatment of ulcerative colitis. Supportive therapy only is not appropriate given the severity of the patient's symptoms.
